alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Kenedy; Inland Kenedy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:47PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kenedy and northeastern Brooks Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kenedy County Sheriffs Office, or over Sarita, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sarita, Kenedy County Wind Farms, Airport Road Addition, Kenedy County Sheriffs Office and Flowella. This includes US Highway 77 between mile markers 712 and 724. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
